title: Winter Olympic Games in PyeongChang 2018 final medal tally
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Number of medals on the Y-axis for 30 different Countrys for 3 groups Gold, Silver, and Bronze that are presented on the X-axis.
For Country Norway, Gold had the highest Number of medals 14.0 among the 3 groups and in Liechtenstein, Gold had the lowest Number of medals 0.0.
Country Norway and Liechtenstein had the biggest gap of 14.0 between the highest and lowest Number of medals found for Silver.
Averaging all 3 groups Gold, Silver, and Bronze, the Country Norway is the maximum Number of medals and Hungary is the minimum Number of medals.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Number of medals on the Y-axis for 30 different Countrys for 3 groups Gold, Silver, and Bronze that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 3 groups, Gold had the highest Number of medals for Country Norway and Gold had the lowest Number of medals for Country Liechtenstein.

For Country Norway, Gold had the highest Number of medals 14.0 among the 3 groups and in Liechtenstein, Gold had the lowest Number of medals 0.0.
Among all the Countrys, Silver had the highest Number of medals in Country Norway and lowest Number of medals in Country Liechtenstein.
The maximum Number of medals for Silver that was found in Country Norway was 0 times larger than the minimum Number of medals observed in Country Liechtenstein.
Among all 3 groups, Gold had the gap of 14.0 between the maximum and minimum Number of medals observed in Country Norway and Liechtenstein respectively.
Gold had the maximum Number of medals out of all 3 groups in Country Norway followed by Gold in Norway, and the minimum Number of medals is found for Gold in Liechtenstein.
